channel.title: Events on Polish City club
channel.description: Recent content in Events on Polish City club

item.title: Event with Greg Hands MP
item.description: Tickets at Eventbrite On 6th June we will have a PCC event at the House of Commons with Greg Hands, MP. Gregory William Hands is a British Conservative Party politician who served as Chief Secretary to the Treasury from 2015 until 2016, and has served as Member of Parliament for Chelsea and Fulham since 2010.

item.title: Henry Balani on Blockchain
item.description: Tickets at Eventbrite Our next PCC event will take place on 4th March at Eight Club Moorgate. We have the pleasure of speaking to Henry Balani about why the Blockchain matters – and why it is different from Bitcoin. His presentation examines the fundamentals of the Blockchain – what it is, why it is useful, and how it is different from Bitcoin. By now nearly everyone has heard of crypto-currencies. While crypto currencies are in the headlines for their volatile value, the technology underlying it is being used by major firms from IBM to JPMorgan across the economy.

item.title: PCC Event with Ania Lichota Executive Coach & AGM
item.description: Tickets at Eventbrite At 6:30pm on 20th June we will start with our Annual General Meeting. The main point on the agenda will be the election of the new President of the Club, as Jakub Molski will be leaving his post after 4 years. It will also be a good opportunity to discuss the plans for the next years and how you can contribute to the Club. NB: Only fully paid mambers have the right to vote.

item.title: Tomasz Czechowicz (MCI)
item.description: Tickets at Eventbrite We are looking forward to seeing you at 7pm at the Eight Club Moorgate. Remember to sign up here, as tickets are already flying off the shelves. Tomasz has been a speaker at the Club a couple of times, yet over the last years he has been especially busy, making his first unicorn investment (Gett), leading rounds for European fintech leaders like iZettle and Azimo or successfully exiting companies with beautiful returns for his investors (Dotpay/eCard sold for PLN 315m vs.
